item.title: By: jerome
item.dc:creator: jerome
item.description: Hi you got the clicking part right in your code, and the transition does fire up. The reason why it doesn't appear to do anything is because you have written .attr("fill","white") as opposed to <strong>.style</strong>("fill","white"). Technically, you can add just any attribute to an element, to look up that value later for instance, but it won't do anything visible. But to change the color, it has to go through style instead. for a nice (and free) resource on svg: http://commons.oreilly.com/wiki/index.php/SVG_Essentials
item.content:encoded:
Hi you got the clicking part right in your code, and the transition does fire up. The reason why it doesn’t appear to do anything is because you have written .attr(“fill”,”white”) as opposed to .style(“fill”,”white”). Technically, you can add just any attribute to an element, to look up that value later for instance, but it won’t do anything visible. But to change the color, it has to go through style instead.
for a nice (and free) resource on svg: http://commons.oreilly.com/wiki/index.php/SVG_Essentials

item.title: By: harry moreno
item.dc:creator: harry moreno
item.description: could you elaborate on how to get a button to respond to clicking? http://bl.ocks.org/3149367 I looked at your sourcecode to get some hints and already went through scott's tutorials.
item.content:encoded: could you elaborate on how to get a button to respond to clicking? http://bl.ocks.org/3149367 I looked at your sourcecode to get some hints and already went through scott’s tutorials.
